name: QIX
summary: Qix (pronounced "kicks") is an arcade game developed by Taito America Corporation and released in October 1981. The objective of Qix is to fence off, or claim, a supermajority of the playfield. At the start of each level, the playing field is a large, empty rectangle, containing the "Qix"—a stick-like entity that performs graceful but unpredictable motions within the confines of the rectangle.
